bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gregory A. Butler is a member of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America (UBC), which represents carpenters, millwrights, dockbuilders, timbermen, cabinetmakers, floorcoverers and industrial workers. Butler was a member of Local 608, which had jurisdiction over the Bronx and the western half of Manhattan. Local 608 dissolved in 2010 and merged its members into Local 157.

Butler is a graduate of the New York City District Council of Carpenters Labor Technical College carpenter apprenticeship program. He is an activist in several left-wing political groups and has written two books, Disunited Brotherhoods' ...Race, racketeering and the fall of the New York construction unions and Lost Towers ...Inside the World Trade Center cleanup. Butler also runs the GANGBOX: Construction Workers News Service on the Yahoo and Google groups' networks and the GANGBOX blog at wordpress.com.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains files related to the organizing efforts and other activities of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America (UBC), Local 608, primarily from the 1990s to early 2000s. To a lesser extent, the collection also contains information on the activities of other UBC locals and various other construction labor unions. The collection consists of correspondence, Local 608 agreements and agreements of other local unions, UBC and other unions' constitutions and bylaws, two cassette tapes, Critical Resistance materials, and UBC publications and reports.
